website_summaries.verdict: The type of budget light meter to choose when you want more flexibility when taking readings.
pros: Large level range up to 100,000 lux
Long cord attached to sensor makes it easier to get up close to light sources for more accurate readings
Easy to operate for first time users
cons: The light sensor peaks out in bright environments such as direct sunlight

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever wondered if that fancy bulb you bought is really producing the amount of light they claimed? Easy to tell with this light meter now! I have been able to test most of the bulbs in my house and find out if they really have the energy savings they claim (based on amount of light output). Pretty surprising results. Most of the CFLs in my house actually were putting out less light than my LEDs (and use more electric doing so). Great to have a meter to measure them!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: good for what i am using it for has 3 power settings so you need to do a little calculating x the number for higher lux. same as an amp meter. for the price it is a very good deal. i am using it to compare different sizes of lights and even if not exact rating, it still shows what ones are brighter than another. good value for the money considering these sell for $100.00 and up for exact measurements
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Comes with nice carrying case and instructions :)
customer_reviews.text: meter actually comes in a nice black carries case i was so surprised to see that come with this order .. I have tested the meter a handful of times and it stacks right up side by side with my much more expensive lumens meters minus the cost part
customer_reviews.author: L&H  Extream Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: Good for plants and photography
customer_reviews.text: For finding light intensity, this is a good and easy way to find your information. I have a lot of plants indoors, such as orchids, carnivorous plants, etc. There is a large range of lux, from 100 to 10,000. This allowed me to check the lux my plants were getting and allowed me to move them accordingly. As I live in California, I do not want my plants to be burning under the intense sun. It's very intuitive and easy to store (as it comes in it's own box). Nice product and pretty cheap. Edit: This is really good for light photography as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Good overall quality, very accurate readings. It would be better if they provided more detailed instructions. After about an hour or two of messing around with the device and watching some youtube videos I got the hang of it and how to actually use it with accurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: ALEX G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Poor Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars but the customer support is non-existent. I called and left a couple of messages wanting to know if there was a correction factor for Metal Halide or HPS bulbs since they were not discussed in their small manual and got no response whats so ever, just the sound of crickets. The device seems to work just fine though - just don't know if I need to apply a correction factor.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Simple and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kid's science project. It works as expected and is very simple to operate. I can't speak to the accuracy, but the results are consistent. If you need a simple light meter, this will do the job. It comes with a simple hard plastic case and foam insert. You'll probably find yourself wandering around the house just to see how much light there is in each room. If nothing else, it gives you a handy way to quantify the difference when you switch light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: I can't vouch for the overall accuracy, but I can say that, unlike another model I tried, the readings are very consistent and repeatable. It allowed me to choose a better headlight bulb for my car.
customer_reviews.author: TCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: but is good enough to help you solve a few problems without ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a high dollar tester, but is good enough to help you solve a few problems without spending an arm and a leg for high dollar unit. If just a rough estimate is all you are looking and don't have a huge budget to work with then this is the unit for you.
customer_reviews.author: Super Dave

customer_reviews.title: For the money this is a good meter, as an electrician I have a professional ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a good meter, as an electrician I have a professional meter that costs 45x more and it's pretty much dead on accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Don Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Good meter for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to measure lumens for my aquatic turtles, bought this for a really good price and was satisfied with its performance and accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised - Short Money
customer_reviews.text: This instrument responds to visible light, not UV or IR radiation. When using for growing plants, be aware that a LUX reading does not reflect the total spectrum output by horticultural light sources. Regardless, the price is right! A decent storage case is also provided.
customer_reviews.author: Kuma

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: This unit does not work right, when I lay it down undder a light, it bounces around and does not give a stable reading.
customer_reviews.author: wade sample

customer_reviews.title: Another friend to the girls and the girls are happy
customer_reviews.text: Helps find those dead spots in the light so you can move the plants around
customer_reviews.author: homegrown

customer_reviews.title: Great value lux meter
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good meter for the price. My only complaint is that its not as sensitive as it could be on the low end. Other then that, its a great lux meter. The cord is long enough, takes a 9v battery. Case is a bit big for it but at least I won't loose it.
customer_reviews.author: Ian MazurskyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great have for maximum yield
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to measure the advertised output of a T5 grow unit and surprisingly everything matched up. Well packaged, easy to use, comes with 9v battery and a nice case. Good job Dr.Meter.

customer_reviews.title: Light Meter
customer_reviews.text: Very cool meter, used it to check light in different areas, mainly to satisfy my curiosity, and it works just fine. Have used it in direct sunlight, shade, light bulbs, and LED lights. Inexpensive enough that I bought it on a whim. Would recommend this meter.

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and easy to use. Granson used it for a science fair project but I use it quite a bit as well. Now you can see what real light plants will get indoors near a window or door.

customer_reviews.title: This was a super cool meter and it works great

That was the reason I bought it, but I was mistaken as to what it really was. If you are looking for a tool to make scientific, or OSHA type measurements this is your tool.

customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the project I needed it for and the price was right.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little tool for setting up indoor gardens and determining sun ray obstructions for outdoor gardening

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a year or so now, measuring the light readings in various gymnasiums. Works fine, no problems at all.

customer_reviews.title: appears to be pretty accurate. great deal for the
customer_reviews.text: comes with heavy duty case and a cover for the sensor. appears to be pretty accurate. great deal for the price

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, hard to figure any correlation between lighting parameters, surface only.

customer_reviews.title: Got more than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm an electrician, not a lighting or electrical engineer. I have a small greenhouse and am hoping to have a successful tomato crop started early. I attempted to find out on line all I could about candlepower, lumens, lux, etc. I got a glimmer of what they were trying to tell me. this Luxmeter, helped me to figure out what I wanted to know.Very inexpensive for a complicated device. I'll know much better when the tomatos come in.

customer_reviews.title: I love this cheap tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this cheap tool. It shows me where I can place another plant for effective lighting. My neighbors borrow it often. Well worth the cheap price.

customer_reviews.title: The meter is easy to use and operate

The instruction manual does include technical information way beyond the application we purchased the meter for. Despite that flaw the meter is very useful and self explanatory.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It seems to give valid readings. I don't have access to any other meters to compare but, for reference work, it works just fine for me. On the negative side, I find the shape wrong - I tend to hold it upside down, taking a few seconds to realize all the text is upside down. It should be fatter at the top and skinnier at the bottom like most other devices of this shape. Also, more digits would make this more convenient, instead of switching ranges when needed. However, for the price, I really can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: JAMacAlister

product_meta.title: Dr.meter LX1010B Digital Illuminance/Light Meter, 0-100,000 Lux Luxmeter
product_meta.description:
Dr.Meter


The digital lux meter Dr.Meter LX1010B can measure up to 100,000 lux, or, approximately 10,000 footcandles. It is used for checking the level of luminance, the measure of the amount of light falling on a given surface.

Features
- LCD Display
- Highly accurate and responsive
- Auto Zeroing
- Over-range indication
- Data Memory
- Low battery alert

Specifications
- Display: 3-1/2 digit 18mm LCD
- Power: 9V battery
- Ranges: 0 - 100,000 Lux
- Accuracy: ±5% 
- Sampling rate: 0.4second
- Operating temperature: 32-122 degrees F (0-50 degrees C)
- Battery life: 200 hours (estimate)
- Dimensions: 4.6x2.7x1.1 inch (118x70x29mm)

Package includes
- 1 x Lux meter DM-LX1010B
- 1 x Carrying case
- 1 x 9V battery
- 1 x User manual
feature_bullets: ▶【Easy-Read LCD】: Whether you're in a bright sunny field or in a tight space, you can always read the Dr.meter Digital Illuminance/Light meter thanks to the large 18mmLCD display with 3-1/2 digits of info.
▶【Large Range】: Whatever you're measuring, you can be sure that this light meter will capture it, as it has a wide range of 0 - 1000,000 Lux for any scenario.
▶【Accuracy】: Get the right reading every time. You can rely on this digital illuminance meter to always read within a +/-5% range.
▶【Quick Reading】: With a speedy sampling rate of 0.4 seconds, you'll never be stuck waiting for your reading to come through.
▶【Long Battery Life】: Powered by a 9V battery, this unit has low energy requirements and will last you for a long time out in the field without needing a change.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars262 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
